qas.question: Where did Charleston's original settlers come from?
Bermuda is located near which North Carolina town?
Who was the first governor of Charleston?
Who predicted Charleston would become a 'great port towne'?
The settlement was relocated east to what river?
Where did Charleston's original settlers not come from?
Bermuda is located near which South Carolina town?
Who was the last governor of Charleston?
Who predicted Charleston would become a 'weak port towne'?
The settlement was relocated west to what river?

context: The community was established by several shiploads of settlers from <a0_0><b5_0>Bermuda<b5_0/><a0_0/> (which lies due east of South Carolina, although at 1,030 km or 640 mi, it is closest to <a1_0><b6_0>Cape Hatteras<b6_0/><a1_0/>, North Carolina), under the leadership of governor <a2_0><b7_0>William Sayle<b7_0/><a2_0/>, on the west bank of the Ashley River, a few miles northwest of the present-day city center. It was soon predicted by the <a3_0><b8_0>Earl of Shaftesbury<b8_0/><a3_0/>, one of the Lords Proprietors, to become a "great port towne", a destiny the city quickly fulfilled. In 1680, the settlement was moved east of the <a4_0><b9_0>Ashley River<b9_0/><a4_0/> to the peninsula between the Ashley and Cooper Rivers. Not only was this location more defensible, but it also offered access to a fine natural harbor.
